verses.verse: Plead<WH7378> my cause<WH3068>, O Lord, with them that argue<WH3401> with me<WH3898>: fight against them that fight against me<WH3898>.
Take hold<WH2388> of shield<WH4043> and shield<WH6793>, and stand up<WH6965> for my help<WH5833>.
Draw out<WH7324> also the spear<WH2595>, and stop<WH5462> the way against<WH7125> them that persecute<WH7291> me<WH559>: say unto my soul<WH5315>, I am your salvation<WH3444>.

Let them be confounded<WH954> and put to shame<WH3637> that seek<WH1245> after my soul<WH5315>: let them be turned<WH5472> back<WH268> and brought to confusion<WH2659> that devise<WH2803> my hurt<WH7451>.
Let them be as chaff<WH4671> before<WH6440> the wind<WH7307>: and let the angel<WH4397> of the Lord<WH3068> chase them<WH1760>.
Let their way<WH1870> be dark<WH2822> and slippery<WH2519>: and let the angel<WH4397> of the Lord<WH3068> persecute them<WH7291>.
For without cause<WH2600> have they hid<WH2934> for me their net<WH7568> in a pit<WH7845>, which without cause<WH2600> they have dug<WH2658> for my soul<WH5315>.
Let destruction<WH7722> come<WH935> upon him at unawares<WH3045>; and let his net<WH7568> that he has hid<WH2934> catch<WH3920> himself<WH7722>: into that very destruction let him fall<WH5307>.
And my soul<WH5315> shall be joyful<WH1523> in the Lord<WH3068>: it shall rejoice<WH7797> in his salvation<WH3444>.

All my bones<WH6106> shall say<WH559>, Lord<WH3068>, who is like unto you<WH5337>, which deliver the poor<WH6041> from him that is too strong<WH2389> for him<WH6041>, Yes, the poor and the needy<WH34> from him that spoils him<WH1497>?
False<WH2555> witnesses<WH5707> did rise up<WH6965>; they laid to my charge<WH7592> things that I knew not<WH3045>.
They rewarded<WH7999> me evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896> to the spoiling<WH7908> of my soul<WH5315>.

But as for me<WH2470>, when they were sick, my clothing<WH3830> was sackcloth<WH8242>: I humbled<WH6031> my soul<WH5315> with fasting<WH6685>; and my prayer<WH8605> returned<WH7725> into my own bosom<WH2436>.
I behaved<WH1980> myself as though he had been my friend<WH7453> or brother<WH251>: I bowed down<WH7817> heavily<WH6937>, as one that mourns<WH57> for his mother<WH517>.

But in my adversity<WH6761> they rejoiced<WH8055>, and gathered themselves together<WH622>: Yes<WH5222>, the attackers gathered themselves together<WH622> against me<WH3045>, and I knew it not<WH7167>; they did tear me<WH1826>, and ceased not:
With hypocritical<WH2611> mockers<WH3934> in feasts<WH4580>, they gnashed<WH2786> upon me with their teeth<WH8127>.
Lord<WH136>, how long will you look on<WH7200>? rescue<WH7725> my soul<WH5315> from their destructions<WH7722>, my darling<WH3173> from the lions<WH3715>.
I will give you thanks<WH3034> in the great<WH7227> congregation<WH6951>: I will praise<WH1984> you among much<WH6099> people<WH5971>.
Let not them that are my enemies<WH341> wrongfully<WH8267> rejoice<WH8055> over me<WH7169>: neither let them wink with the eye<WH5869> that hate<WH8130> me without a cause<WH2600>.
For they speak<WH1696> not peace<WH7965>: but they devise<WH2803> deceitful<WH4820> matters<WH1697> against them that are quiet<WH7282> in the land<WH776>.
Yes<WH6310>, they opened their mouth wide<WH7337> against me<WH559>, and said, Aha<WH1889>, aha<WH1889>, our eye<WH5869> has seen it<WH7200>.
This you have seen<WH7200>, O Lord<WH3068>: keep not silence<WH2790>: O Lord<WH136>, be not far from me<WH7368>.
Stir up<WH5782> yourself<WH6974>, and awake to my judgment<WH4941>, even unto my cause<WH7379>, my God<WH430> and my Lord<WH136>.
Judge<WH8199> me<WH3068>, O Lord my God<WH430>, according to your righteousness<WH6664>; and let them not rejoice over me<WH8055>.
Let them not say<WH559> in their hearts<WH3820>, Ah<WH1889>, so would we have it<WH5315>: let them not say<WH559>, We have swallowed him up<WH1104>.

Let them be ashamed<WH954> and brought to confusion<WH2659> together<WH3162> that rejoice<WH8056> at my hurt<WH7451>: let them be clothed<WH3847> with shame<WH1322> and dishonor<WH3639> that magnify themselves against me<WH1431>.

Let them shout for joy<WH7442>, and be glad<WH8055>, that favor<WH2655> my righteous cause<WH6664>: Yes<WH559>, let them say continually<WH8548>, Let the Lord<WH3068> be magnified<WH1431>, which has pleasure<WH2655> in the prosperity<WH7965> of his servant<WH5650>.
And my tongue<WH3956> shall speak<WH1897> of your righteousness<WH6664> and of your praise<WH8416> all the day long<WH3117>.
